fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1907].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz at atlassian dot com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

I would like to be able to add a watcher/person to be notified of changes in issue but which is external to our organization.
I don't want him to see everything what is happening on a project (that's what notification schemes are for) and I don't want to create him as an user in our Jira (to make him a regular watcher).
I only want him to be notified over e-mail when issue is resolved, for instance.
I imagine that to be done by entering his e-mail to an additional issue field.

-- Damjan Perenic
fields.summary: Ability to add watchers/notifications to a single issue (Issue roles)

fields.description:
Searching for issues "Updated before" a certain date does not work. All issues are returned without regard to the date.

Searching and creating filters with "Updated after" works fine, though. 

It looks like the parameter is never sent to the WW-action -- when the page displays the search result the "Updated before" field is empty.

I tried it on 2.2Pro, and on 2.2.1Enterprise (this site) and none works.

-- Anders Engstr?m
fields.summary: Search issue by "Updated before" is not working

fields.description:
German characters are still distorted (as in 2.1), but now they get doubled on every submit of a change. While Jira 2.1 has been inconvenient to use, 2.2 is absolutely unusable on a german site.
All the cool improvements are worthless if this old bug will not be fixed soon!

(I reported this bug a couple of days ago, but it seems to got lost on the server crash.)

-- Rainer Schmitz
fields.summary: German characters are doubled on any change

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to select the custom fields that are shown on the action pages.  Eg I might like to present a custom field to the user, along with the default fields, when he selects "Resolve issue".  Otherwise, it seems you can only modify custom fields if you "Edit" an issue.

-- David Aldrich

-- David Aldrich

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

This suggestion is a priority for the JIRA development team, but I am not able to provide an accurate estimate for when this will be resolved. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

A new file attachment should be also considered as notification event.

-- Arpad
fields.summary: Notification event on file attachment

fields.description:
Using 2.1, Not all notofications are going out, when they should.
for example, a project using a notofication schema like:
Issue Commented:
  	  Current User  (Del)
          Current Reporter (Del)
          All Watchers (Del) 

The Current user did not get the notofication after a comment.
the Reporter (The person who reported the issue) did get the notofication.
I could not examine this issue fully but the behaviur looks strange.
For example once I managed to send the notification to the assignee, but not to the Reporter (which was also in the schema that time)

-- Arpad P.
fields.summary: Notifications are not  going out

fields.description:
Doucemntation does not specify how to upgrade. Well, at least I could not find it.
As 2.2 is out and we are having some difficulties with 2.1, we would like to upgrade to 2.2. But I am not sure what files are to be downleded from where, and what to install, to preserve the configuration and licence.

-- Arpad P.
fields.summary: Doucmentation: upgrade
Add more shortcut keys

In the Time Tracking Report,the version that is selected is the Affected Version. I would expect that the Report should be run on the Fix Version.

-- Eric Pretty
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report - Version selection

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1893].
  {panel}

When I am an assignee to an issue, I oftenly need to ask somebody about someting via e-mail so that my e-mail and responce became a comments to the issue.
It would be nice to introduce separate operation like "send e-mail", when I would be able to type target address manually. It is also sufficient that reply to such e-mail be acceptable by standard comment logger service whether my addressee is known to JIRA or not (at least one time).
This would give very flexible way to geather information to the issue and the like.

Additional details
1. It seems reasonable having separate permission to perform such action
2. It would be convenient to have separate template for such e-mails

-- Andrey Khapugin
fields.summary: Add ability to send e-mail to any address, so that it became a comment to an issue

fields.description:
If we use the 'due date' field, I can imagine someone (management types) wanting to view a report on 'late' issues.  JIRA currently has an 'outstanding' report but this only filters on the 'unresolved' status.  How about a preset that filters 'unresolved' issues that are also 'late' (as determined by the due date field, of course). 
 
Or....

I tried to implement this as a saved filter, by searching for issues that were still open and due after 'today'.  But that saves today's date in the filter, not the "concept" of 'today' (if ya know what i mean). 
 
Enhancing the filtering screen to allow a hard-coded date, as well as ideas like "last week" or "today" might solve this.

-- Mike Curwen
fields.summary: Due Date and filtering

fields.description:
Permission lookups could be made more efficent when searching for all projects.

-Owen

fields.description:
The time estimate column on the Excel view does not seem to take into account time tracking setup.

My time tracking setup is :
The number of working hours per day is 7.
The number of working days per week is 5. 

For example, 1 have an issue whose estimated time is 4 days (28 hours) but shows up as 1 day 4 hours (28 hours if I would be using the default setup but is 11 hours in our setup).

-- Francois Beauregard

fields.description:
There are a lot of users reporting problems when upgrading JIRA due to portals with no users.

This may be because we do not remove the portal page config when we delete users, and in the upgrade task, and we try to upgrade it anyhow.

We should remove the portal config when users are deleted, and in the upgrade task, remove any configs for users that don't exist.
fields.summary: Remove PortalPageConfiguration when users are deleted

fields.description:
Everytime I trie to enter some non-ascii text into some customizable field (eg, priority descripton) JIRA doesn't get it right.

If the charset encoding is set to UTF-8 in the global configuration, wrong characters come instead of the one entered at the text box. If the charset encoding is set to ISO-8859-1 in the global configuration, question marks come instead of the one entered at the text box.

I'm attaching a screenshot showing the wrong characters.

I've found some issues that seems to be related to this, all of them marked as 'Closed'. Here they are:

JRA-64
JRA-457 (master issue)
JRA-820

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1876].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; however there are no immediate plans to put this suggestion on our near term roadmap.

For more advanced time tracking reporting functionality I'd suggest to check out the add-ons on the  [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com] that are mentioned in the comments below.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz at atlassian dot com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

We'd like to see the per-developer time tracking report in JIRA for a given period. After selecting a period (e.g. July, or 12-19 May etc.) JIRA should show a total time, reported by each developer in this period. 

It would be good if JIRA showed in the same report which issues the developer has closed during that time and how much did he spend for it.
fields.summary: Developer time tracker report

fields.description: Making a zipped backup is possible by hand, but not as a service. Please add this feature.
fields.summary: Create zipped backups

fields.description:
We have a project which have a project key containing Norwegian characters. This was not a problem in Jira 1.4.

This week we upgraded to Jira 2.0.2. Now, when a issue in this project is closed, the following error message is displayed: "The issue key or ID that you entered does not exist in the system. Please check the key or ID you entered."

The issue *is* correctly closed, so we suspect that a "view issue" redirect is performed, in which the URL containing the issue key is not correctly encoded and decoded.


(We have not tested this in more recent versions of Jira. We attempted to upgrade to 2.2 Professional but had to roll back due to massive performance problems with that version. This problem was discovered after the upgrade.)
fields.summary: International characters in issue IDs not handled correctly

fields.description:
We designed JIRA workflow so that plain users do not have assign permission at all and assignments will be done by team leaders only. however, this warning message below confuses the users, they think something went wrong:

You do not have permission to assign this issue, this issue will be unassigned 

If this message is configurable somewhere, I would like to change it to "This issue will be assigned by the Project Leader". I tried to add this comment to Assignee field description, but it is not displayed at all.
fields.summary: Permisson error message not clear enough.

fields.description:
The time tracking report gives wrong totals.
See attached image.

In time tracking :
The number of working hours per day is 7.
The number of working days per week is 5. 

Note that I first entered issues with the default time tracking options (ie 24h and 7d). Switched it off and back on with the new settings. Data for individual issue seem fine.
fields.summary: Wrong total on time tracking report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1871].
  {panel}

I've been playing with the 'new' (to me) custom fields feature.  Very cool.  Especially how you can scope them to 'global, per project or per issue type'.
 
We can also customize issue types, priorities and resolutions.
 
I was wondering if it's crazy to dream of a day when JIRA might allow 'scoping' of these built-in fields as well?
 
It would be very handy.  We could open up our JIRA install to serve external customers that only wanted to have one issue type (IE: a complaint!)
 
I think with many end-customers, having to select amongst bug, task, inprovement, new feature is daunting.
 
And hey... while we're at it... the fields that appear on "the next page" like version, environment, assigned to, etc...   Could those be configurable as well
 
Does it sound like I'm wanting JIRA to morph into a CRM-like application?   ;)
fields.summary: Custom Issue Types + scope

fields.description:
Short description of related/example of what I mean:
When you first log in and haven't yet selected a project, and you click on 'Browse Project', you are presented with a list of projects to choose from.  Once you actually choose a project, then the 'Browse Project' link remembers your 'current' selection (I'm guessing it's in the session).  To get back to a list of ALL projects, you'd need to click the "Projects:" link (In front of the project name on BrowseProject.jspa) to get a listing of all projects.
 
Ok..
 
So how about 'Find Issues' using the 'current' project in a similar way?  The reason this would be kinda cool, is that right now, if you have custom fields within your project, you can't search on them without first choosing the project and doing an initial "throw away" search first.
 
After the project is 'set', the custom field for that project does show up at the bottom of the left column.  But if we used the 'current' project then we wouldn't need the throw away.
 
Doable?  Insane?
fields.summary: 'Find Issues' and using the 'current project'

fields.description:
Going to : 
http://localhost:8080/jira/secure/admin/ViewMailServers.jspa

I get: "You do not currently have any POP servers configured. "
 
Even though I did configure one, and emailing works.
fields.summary: Email server not showing up in list

fields.description:
On the default front page, the 'introduction' portlet is not displayed.
 
Also, can't seem to find where to edit it ( I thought it used to be under L&F)
fields.summary: Can't find where to edit the Introduction portlet
Backup attachments also

fields.description:
It would be nice if it was possible to get a service to run every:
 - day (at a specific time)
 - monday, friday (at a specific time)
 - on specefic days during a month (1st, 10th etc) (at a specific time)

instead of just setting a delay in seconds
fields.summary: Use specific time instead of delay in services

fields.description:
After adding in a new version, and adding new issues to that version, one does not see the version with the number of open issues for it when they click on the "open issues" link for a project.

However, if they click on road map, they see the version with a list of the issues under it.  There is a problem with this too.  The issues all say a status of UNRESOLVED, but the progress bar shows green and when you place your mouse over it, the tool tip says "0 of 3 issues UNRESOLVED".

We then started the server, and reloaded everything, and both issues went away.  This leads me to believe it is a caching problem.
fields.summary: Caching problem when adding a new release version for a project

fields.description:
I think this may be a different use case than the statistics not updating on issue resolve.

I went in to change up some of our version names. We have a 1.0.1 and a 1.1.  I renamed 1.1 to 1.2, then I renamed 1.0.1 to 1.1. When going into the browse project, 1.1 had a huuuge progress bar, and said, "24 of 9 issues are unresolved". So it had some data from the old 1.1, and the open issues from the new 1.1 I think.

Just wanted to make sure when we rename versions or play with them, the statistics also update.  Thanks!
fields.summary: Refresh statistics on issue rename

fields.description:
The fonts for a link vs a visited link in the leftnav in the new 2.x documentation are different.

You see a list of items with their yellow bullets. If you click a section, then reload, the font for the link you just clicked becomes a little bit larger and has more spacing between the characters.

If they aren't supposed to indicate visited, they should probably be the same.  (My worst nitpick yet!  ;)  Fantastic documention in this version, though -- very helpful.)
fields.summary: Fonts for link vs visited link different on documentation
Roadmap: Display remaining work per Version

fields.description:
When doing customization, I sometimes need to store extra information at the issue level.  Custom fields seem to be the approved way of doing this.  However, sometimes the data I need to store is "internal", in the sense that it isn't meant to be viewable by end users.

In thses cases, it would be nice to have "invisible" custom fields.  These would act pretty much like regular custom fields, but would not show up in any issue view or edit screens.

It seems like you could add a field "visislbe" to the entitymodel for custom fields, and have the user select visibility when defining the new field.  Then just check this property in the views to see if the field should be displayed.
fields.summary: "invisible" custom fields

fields.description:
We use the summary page (together with our customers) to allocate and prioritize work. We have now found out that those figues are wrong, and that we cannot rely on them. 

The main reason for selecting JIRA over free software was the overview (that we now rely on)!

fields.description:
Character encoding fails in 2.1.

Entering any text on Russian in 2.1 Pro all characters became unreadable in the next screen.
I've checked almost all fields in Administration screens and of course "Create new bug".

The effect apears with both: JIRA with built-in database (UTF-8) and with MySQL as a back-end (KOI8_R), but the way characters are chenged differs in different encodings (UTF-8 gives number of characters twice bugger then I've entered).

I've collected some details that may help.

1. I've found a similar note from German user in jira-user mailing list. It has the same subject as this report.

2. This effect completely absent in 2.0.2.

3. It seems to be absent in 2.1 Enterprise #48 that I am using right now (I have another report here with 1 russian word in subject and I can see it OK).

4. Russian characters can be imported OK from XML backup.

It seems that the problem is somewhere in the code that works with data grabbed from WEB-forms.

Best wishes,
Andrey Khapugin,
Excelsior
fields.summary: Character encoding fails in 2.1

fields.description:
When you add an attachment, you usually add a comment.

However, the comments and the attachments are displayed separately - and there is no association between the attachment and the comment.

It means you have to guess which comment applies to which attachment.

It also means that you have comments that dont make sense (e.g. "stacktrace") because they were written as if they were a label for the attachment rather than a stand-alone comment

Either the Attachment Comments need to be displayed differently - ie seperately to regular comments
or
a URL to the actual attachment should be added to the comment.


-Nick
fields.summary: Display attachment comments associated with their attachments

fields.description:
We've set up a pop mail server and added the com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService, using the Full Comment Handler. When we send an email to our "comment" address, everything works fine if it us just plain test. However, if it is plain text, with an html formatted version as an attachment, it seems to throw things for a loop. The plain text portion of the email gets attached to the issue as a comment, but then the srvice throws an exception and never gets a chance to delete the email from the pop3 server. As a result, when the service runs again, it creates another comment, witht he previous text, and dies again. It just continues to add the same comment over and over until we manually delete the service or the email. fields.description:
It would be much easier to "link" issues if you could select the issues from a drop down list, or something similar. 

At the moment the workflow around linking issue is awkward, as the user has to know the issue code before starting the linking process.
fields.summary: Make linking issues easier to do

fields.description:
It would be really useful to have one of the following features added to JIRA, when creating a new issue : 

1) Ability to attach docs to an issue during the create process. Therefore making this a one step process, rather than a two step process (and hence reducing the email notifications generated). 

and/or 

2) Ability to cut/paste pictures (e.g. screenshots) in to the description section of the issue.
fields.summary: Ability to add attachments when creating issue

fields.description: The timetracking report does not print very well, add a show printable version option.
fields.summary: Timetracking report should be printable

fields.description: Was reviewing a full content report of a filter, and realized there were no status fields being displayed.  I see assignee, reporter, resolution.  Could this be added, preferably with the status icon?
fields.summary: Full content view does not show issue status

fields.description:
It would be nice to have single signon support with JIRA.  

Currently JIRA is dependant on OSUSER which does not support Single Signon. 

OSUSER with only authenticate a user by passng a userid and password. What I would like is an authenticate method where only the request uis being passed.  This would enable the ability to write your own credentialsProviders that detect who the user is from the request (becouse they have already ben authenticated to site by some other means) and therefor do not need to be promted for a user id or password.
fields.summary: Single-Signon support

fields.description:
I have recently discovered that anybody can log into JIRA as either themselves or others users without a password. 

We have configured OSUSER to use the LDAPCredentialsProvider so It may be a bug in this provider only.  I have tested whether the same happens without the LDAPCredentialsProvder.
fields.summary: Security hole: Users can get into JIRA without a password

fields.description: The calendar and due date popups do not populate the opener form on Netscape 4, making the popups rather useless.
fields.summary: Calendar and Due Date popups do not populate the opener form on NN4

fields.description:
On Line 25 of com.atlassian.jira.web.action.project.AddProjectEntity

There is defined:
    Long pid;

Which is hiding the
    Long pid;

defined in com.atlassian.jira.web.action.project.ViewProject (which AddProjectEntity inherits from)

There doesnt seem to be a problem because pid isnt accessed directly in any of the classes that extend AddProjectEntity ... but if they do... they will have null.

-Nick
fields.summary: Bug Waiting to happen?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1830].
  {panel}

The custom field are very nice, but to have the time tracking system address all of our needs, we would need to have custom fields per work log.  Some example categories we would want to track:
- date work was done (the date you write down your hours isn't always the date you did the work)
- intended billing rate (what were we billing when we did the work)
- actual billed rate (how much were we actually able to put on the invoice)
- work type (development, testing, documentation, etc...)

If we had the ability to add custom fields per work entry, we could add these fields as necessary, then build our own reports to produce invoices, burn rates for the month, utilization, etc...

Hopefully this isn't that great an extension.
fields.summary: Custom field per work-log

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to use the new notification system (which is very nice, BTW) to send mail to arbitrary addresses.  These addresses might not be associated with JIRA users.

A simple way of doing this would be to add another choice to the list displayed for the AddNotification action.  It could be called "Value of Custom Field", and would take a single parameter.  This would be the name of a custom field defined on the issue.  JIRA would lookup the value of this field and use the value as a (comma delimited list of?) email address.
fields.summary: notifications sent to value of custom field

fields.summary: If two administrators delete the same Permission Scheme - you get a 500 error : Sink GenericValue can not be null

fields.description:
I would like to be able to not use cookies when using Jira., but Jira requires cookies to log in. If you don't, login doesn't work, and you are redirected to the same login page, without error.
Either Jira should work witout cookies (my preference), either a message should be given to the user to nofity him that he needs cookies.

See also JRA-1624 which could be solved by asking user to disable cookies as a workaround if Jira was capable of not using cookies.
See also some bugs such JRA-1826 that I just created.
fields.summary: Allow users to use JIRA without cookies

fields.description:
I browse without cookies enabled.
I searched for all bugs containing the word cookies. I clicked on the first one:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-1704
On the linked bug list, there was JRA-1432. The URL which was pointing to it was:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JRA-1432;jsessionid=JFFFFCCMEEJM

I clicked on it, and there was a failure as ViewIssue interpreted the bug number to be JRA-1432;jsessionid=JFFFFCCMEEJM instead of JRA-1432.
fields.summary: ViewIssue doesn't parse URL correctly when browsing without cookies

fields.description:
A lot of users have asked to be able to hide default fields in JIRA. 

This would be a single administration page, with two select lists (a bit like release versions page). Lists would be 'shown' and 'hidden' fields. 

Hidden fields would be removed from:
- create / edit issue
- view issue
- issue navigator search form and issue list
fields.summary: Show / Hide Default Fields

fields.description:
I would like to create an issue AND attach a word document.
I can't find the way though to make the attachment.
Where should I click?

Thanks.
fields.summary: How can I attach a file in JIRA?

fields.description: One of the nicest features of Bugzilla that I have not found in Jira yet is the ability to change multiple bugs all at once.  This would be a great enhancement for project leads.
fields.summary: Changing Multiple Bugs all at once

fields.description:
Any link that leads to http://localhost:8080/jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?mode=show&createNew=true

for any user (administrator or regular user) results in a blank page.

No error, just blank.
fields.summary: filter screens are blank

fields.description:
from the view projects page http://localhost:8080/jira/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa

click on the permissions link results in an HTTP 404 error (below).  However, I can get to project permissions by clicking on the edit permissions link from the individual project page.

HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [ProjectPermissions]:Action 'ProjectPermissions' not found or could not be initialized: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: ProjectPermissions

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

type Status report

message Could not execute action [ProjectPermissions]:Action 'ProjectPermissions' not found or could not be initialized: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: ProjectPermissions

description The requested resource (Could not execute action [ProjectPermissions]:Action 'ProjectPermissions' not found or could not be initialized: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: ProjectPermissions) is not available.
fields.summary: project permissions link leads to HTTP 404 message

fields.description: Recently, you hid the "no attachments" and "no link" boxes on the issue view. Could you also do the same on the full content view Anything to reduce the size of this page is beneficial.  (I use it for status meeting project updates, for example.)
fields.summary: Hide no attachments/no link boxes on full content view

fields.description:
I like the new user picker, but I wanted to select a group name for a filter I was creating.

Could we show the group name above the list of users, and make it clickkable?  It would close the user picker, and put the group name in my filter box, just like when I click highlighted user row in the table.
fields.summary: Allow the user picker to select groups
Get filter results for external processes in 'private' mode

fields.description:
We had a case where a user left the company and needed to delete his account. When we did, we could not delete him because he is a reporter on two issues. The only way to fix it was to either mod the DB or backup  to xml, find issues user has in xml file and change to admin account.

There should be a function where by if upon deleting the user and they have issues associated with them that there is an option to continue deleting and change user to another.
fields.summary: An interface to handle users that need to be removed from project

fields.description:
Make portlets more like 'windows': give them minimize-buttons, so you can stack them on your dashboard (hide them except the basic info) 

- Make the order of the projects in the dashboard editable so you can prioritize projects
fields.summary: Portlet and dashboard improvements
Forward to 'Log work' page after Stop Progress transition

fields.description:
The tomcat docs do not tell the user where to put (or more accuratly where not to put) the war file.

The docs should say that the war file should not be placed in the webapps directory as this causes tomcat to deploy JIRA twice.
The second deployment casuses jdbc errors because there is no datasource defined in its context.
fields.summary: Tomcat docs should be updated

fields.description:
This will make the statistic loading much faster. 

This depends on JRA-1793.
fields.summary: Improve statistics to use summary functions
i18n problem.can't surport simple Chinese

fields.description:
It would be nice if when creating a custom field of type date you could set the default value to be the current date.

e.g. Work started date.
fields.summary: Current date default value for customfield

fields.description: After I imported all data from Bugzilla, some issues that were assigned to particular user in Bugzilla, became unassigned in Jira.
fields.summary: Import from Bugzilla changes status to Unassigned

fields.description:
Type in the documentation. Can be found on your website at http://atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v2.1/setup.html.

Paragraph in documentation:
One this page you can set some of the JIRA configuration settings, and enter your license key.

Should read:
On this page you can set some of the JIRA configuration settings, and enter your license key.
fields.summary: Typo in Setup Wizard documentation

fields.description: Unresolved issues have a fixed value of "UNRESOLVED" set for resolution. All resolutions, but that one, can be localized (renamed).
fields.summary: Localizing Resolution is impossible for unresolved issues

fields.description:
We need to restrict the usage of JIRA for upgrades where the license is over one year old.

We should let them use JIRA for 2 months after the release date, but then they will need to purchase an upgrade.
fields.summary: Restrict license keys over one year old

fields.description:
First of all : I made a mistake with my previous isue [CORE-4] (it should be in JIRA not in the CORE I suppose). It has nothing to do with this one but it's only fair to mention it.(Sorry)

I want to assign an issue to more then 1 person (we use extreme programming => we work in pairs).
If an issue is created I need to create a second one and link it to the first one (there identical).

Seems a bit overkill doesn't it.

So my proposition is to make the assignee a collection, that way you can assign as many people to an issue as you want.

Also need the ability to delete a person from the assignee list + if it's the last one on the list allow it and set unknown.

Regards

Kristof
fields.summary: assign issue to multiple developers
